str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To flog, scourge, the victim being strapped to a pole or frame; met: I chastise. From mastix; to flog.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
